729778f-a.title: Richmond: Travis Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729778f-a.text:
Travis Avenue, north side, about 3UO yards
west of Richmond Avenue, showing hay making on
the Dedrich Eugo farm (1907-19l'), and the farmhouse.
In 1898 the farm belonged to Edward Snyder.
March 12, 1927
P. L. Sperr
729778f-a.folder: Travis Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729351f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Travis Avenue
729351f-a.text:
Eichmond Avenue, at the S.W. corner of Travis
Avenue. Beers's 1874 map shows the house to have belonged
to W. S. Mesier.
August 1, 1937
P. L. Sperr
729351f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Travis Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729775f-a.title: Richmond: Travis Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729775f-a.text:
Travis Avenue, east from June Avenue (east of Victory),
showing the blossoming countryside in the spring.
May 6, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A blossoming tree on Travis Avenue, near Richmond
Avenue.
May 9, 1926
P. L. Sperr

729776f-a.title: Richmond: Travis Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729776f-a.text:
Travis Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Richmond Avenue, showing
the old Crocheron House. It is about 250 years old.
About 1900
By C. A. Ingalls
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
729776f-a.folder: Travis Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729777f-a.title: Richmond: Travis Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729777f-a.text:
Travis Avenue, north side, about 400 feet west of Richmond
AVenue, showing the Crocheron Homestead.
About 1900
PIy Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
